thread.title: Canada's Buchanan makes shortlist for women's FIFA Ballon d'Or award as best player
thread.title_full: Canada's Buchanan makes shortlist for women's FIFA Ballon d'Or award as best player - Winnipeg Free Press

author: The Associated Press
title: Canada's Buchanan makes shortlist for women's FIFA Ballon d'Or award as best player
text:
ZURICH - Canada's Kadeisha Buchanan, one of the breakout stars at this summer's Women's World Cup, is among 10 players shortlisted for the 2015 Ballon D'Or award for the women's world soccer player of the year.
The 19-year-old native of Brampton, Ont., who plays for West Virginia University, won the World Cup's Hyundai Young Player Award and was the lone Canadian on the tournament all-star squad.
Americans Hope Solo and Megan Rapinoe and Carli Lloyd are also in the running, along with Germany's Nadine Angerer, who won the award in 2013.
The United States, which won the World Cup in July, is the best represented country on the shortlist with the three players.
Japan, which lost 5-2 to the U.S. in the cup final on May 5, has one representative — Aya Miyama — while Germany and France have two players each among the 10.
Brazil's Marta, who won the award every year from 2006 to 2010 and was the runner-up last year, did not make the shortlist.
FIFA also listed 10 names for the women's team coach of the year award.
___
Player shortlist:
Nadine Angerer (Germany/Brisbane Roar/Portland Thorns) Ramona Bachmann (Switzerland/FC Rosengard)
Kadeisha Buchanan (Canada/West Virginia University)
Amandine Henry (France/Olympique Lyonnais)
Eugenie Le Sommer (France/Olympique Lyonnais)
Carli Lloyd (U.S./Houston Dash)
Aya Miyama (Japan/Okayama Yunogo Belle)
Megan Rapinoe (U.S./Seattle Reign)
Celia Sasic (Germany/1.FFC Frankfurt)
Hope Solo (U.S./Seattle Reign)
— With files from The Canadian Press
